identificationModule.briefTitle: Circulatory Function in Laparoscopic Radical Cystectomy for Bladder Cancer
identificationModule.officialTitle: Preliminary Study on the Changes of Perioperative Circulatory Function in Patients Undergoing Laparoscopic Radical Cystectomy for Bladder Cancer

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Principal Investigator, clinical attending in anesthesia department

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To optimize the perioperative management of patients undergoing laparoscopic radical cystectomy(LPC) for bladder cancer through observation of perioperative changes of Brain Natriuretic Peptide(BNP), stroke volume variation(SVV), central venous pressure(CVP) and the use of transthoracic echocardiography(TTE).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Long term pneumoperitoneum and steep trendelenburg in LPC for bladder cancer influence perioperative circulatory function, resulting in a series of pathophysiological changes. BNP is of high sensitivity and specificity in the evaluation of cardiac function. SVV and CVP are dynamic and static indices to predict fluid responsiveness. TTE is a good indicator of volume and cardiac function.Thus, we conducted the trial to assess the perioperative circulatory function in patients undergoing LPC. We hypothesized that long term pneumoperitoneum and steep trendelenburg in LPC for bladder cancer would increase perioperative blood volume and influence cardiac function.

conditions: Laparoscopic Radical Cystectomy for Bladder Cancer
keywords: laparoscopic radical cystectomy for bladder cancer

primaryOutcomes.description: To observe the change of BNP perioperatively.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: before induction (T1), at the end of operation(T2), at 12 hours (T3) and 24 hours (T4) postoperatively

primaryOutcomes.description: To observe the change of CVP perioperatively.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: before induction (T1),at the end of operation (T2), at 12 hours (T3) and 24 hours (T4) postoperatively

primaryOutcomes.description: To observe the change of SVV perioperatively.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: before induction (T1), at the end of operation (T2)

primaryOutcomes.description: To observe the change of End-diastolic volume(EDV) perioperatively
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: before induction (T1),at the end of operation (T2), at 12 hours (T3) and 24 hours (T4) postoperatively

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* undergoing laparoscopic radical cystectomy for bladder cancer
* ASA I-II

Exclusion Criteria:

* Cardiac insufficiency
* Hepatic insufficiency
* Renal insufficiency
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients who undergo laparoscopic radical cystectomy for bladder cancer in Renji Hospital
